00:00:05:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:05:140000.Dialogue: What happens if they can't get any human flesh to eat? They can't starve to death-- they're already dead.

00:00:11:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:11:170000.Dialogue: You take this one. I spent an hour last night on How do vampires shave when they can't see themselves in the mirror?

00:00:19:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:19:090000.Dialogue: Well-groomed vampires meet in pairs and shave each other-- case closed.

00:00:26:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:26:170000.Dialogue: I guess it depends on the zombies, Raj. Are we talking slow zombies, fast zombies? Like, in 28 Days, if those zombies didn't eat, they starved.

00:00:32:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:32:170000.Dialogue: You're thinking of 28 Days Later. 28 Days is where Sandra Bullock goes to rehab and puts the audience into an undead state

00:00:41:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:41:060000.Dialogue: Hey, don't bag on Sandra Bullock! You think it makes you look cultured, but you just come off as bitter.

00:00:50:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:50:120000.Dialogue: Why's the president of the university slumming in the cafeteria?

00:00:54:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:54:190000.Dialogue: Perhaps he's emulating Shakespeare's Henry V, who dressed as a commoner and mingled among them, to find out how he was being perceived by his subjects. Of course, if he'd have read any of the 1,300 e-mails I've sent him on the subject of his administration, he could have saved himself the trouble.

00:01:09:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:09:010000.Dialogue: Or maybe he heard it's Tator Tot Tuesday. That's why I'm here.

00:01:14:080000.Speaker: Dr. Seibert
00:01:14:080000.Dialogue: Hey, there's my favorite geniuses! How are we doing today?

00:01:18:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:18:090000.Dialogue: That depends-- how much longer do you plan on fondling my shoulder?

00:01:22:120000.Speaker: Seibert
00:01:22:120000.Dialogue: Sorry, Dr. Cooper, I forgot you have a touch phobia.

00:01:25:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:25:130000.Dialogue: It's not a touch phobia, it's a germ phobia. If you'd like to go put on a pair of latex gloves, I'll let you check me for a hernia.

00:01:32:140000.Speaker: Seibert
00:01:32:140000.Dialogue: Yeah. So, listen, fellas, who's up for a little party this Saturday night? Open bar, good eats, might even be a few pretty girls.

00:01:41:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:41:140000.Dialogue: Hold on. Just because the nice man is offering you candy, doesn't mean you should jump into his windowless van.

00:01:51:080000.Speaker: Seibert
00:01:51:080000.Dialogue: Just a little fund-raiser for the university.

00:01:53:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:53:120000.Dialogue: Aha! The tear-stained air mattress in the back of the van.

00:01:58:020000.Speaker: Seibert
00:01:58:020000.Dialogue: I understand your reticence, Dr. Cooper, and I sympathize, but the hard facts are, occasionally, we have to shake a few hands and kiss a few butts to raise money for our research.

00:02:06:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:06:170000.Dialogue: I don't care; it's demeaning. And I refuse to be trotted out and shown off like a prize hog at the Texas State Fair. Which, by the way, is something you don't want to attend wearing a Star Trek ensign's uniform.

00:02:18:070000.Speaker: Seibert
00:02:18:070000.Dialogue: All right, let me put it this way. You're gonna put on a suit, you're gonna come to this party, and you're gonna explain your research to a bunch of old people, or I swear to God, I'll blind you with a hot spoon, like they did to that little boy in Slumdog Millionaire.

00:02:35:000000.Speaker: Seibert
00:02:35:000000.Dialogue: So, Saturday night! It's gonna be off the hook.

00:02:42:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:42:170000.Dialogue: Oh, boy! Tator tots and a party invitation? What a great day!

00:03:20:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:20:190000.Dialogue: Are you sure this is right?

00:03:22:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:22:200000.Dialogue: Yeah, just tuck that part in your pants; you'll be fine.

00:03:26:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:26:230000.Dialogue: Okay, let's go smooch some rich, wrinkled tochis.

00:03:31:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:03:31:230000.Dialogue: Oh, Howard, I can't believe Bernadette let you go to a fancy party wearing a dickey.

00:03:36:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:36:020000.Dialogue: Excuse me, my girlfriend doesn't pick out my clothes. My mother does.

00:03:46:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:46:130000.Dialogue: Really? What do we tell Siebert?

00:03:48:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:48:230000.Dialogue: Tell him Dr. Cooper feels that the best use of his time is to employ his rare and precious mental faculties to tear the mask off nature and stare at the face of God.

00:04:00:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:00:100000.Dialogue: Sheldon, it's Saturday night, you'll be doing laundry.

00:04:03:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:03:090000.Dialogue: Don't tell him that, tell him the mask thing.

00:04:12:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:04:12:090000.Dialogue: Hey, put your tie back in your pants.

00:04:16:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:16:110000.Dialogue: Nice place. Reminds me of my parents' house back in New Delhi.

00:04:32:150000.Speaker: Seibert
00:04:32:150000.Dialogue: Ah. There's my band of brainiacs. Where's Dr. Cooper?

00:04:38:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:38:170000.Dialogue: He's tearing the mask off nature to look at the face of God.

00:04:43:000000.Speaker: Seibert
00:04:43:000000.Dialogue: The board of directors insists he has a beautiful mind. I think he's just bananas. Come on, let me introduce you to one of the university's leading donors.

00:04:53:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:53:150000.Dialogue: I think we were misled about the cute girls.

00:04:56:220000.Speaker: Seibert
00:04:56:220000.Dialogue: Mrs. Latham, I'd like you to meet three of our outstanding young researchers. This is Dr. Leonard Hofstadter, Dr. Rajesh Koothrappali and Howard Wolowitz.

00:05:05:210000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:05:05:210000.Dialogue: Well, what happened to you, Wolowitz, couldn't stick with it long enough to get your PhD?

00:05:10:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:10:060000.Dialogue: I'm an engineer. Most engineers don't bother with a PhD. But you may be interested to know I designed the zero-gravity waste-disposal system for NASA.

00:05:19:050000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:05:19:050000.Dialogue: Got it-- you're a space plumber.

00:05:23:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:23:210000.Dialogue: I'm gonna go hit the bar.

00:05:29:200000.Speaker: Seibert
00:05:29:200000.Dialogue: Dr. Hofstadter is representing our experimental physics program tonight. I think you'll really enjoy hearing about his fascinating work.

00:05:42:190000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:05:42:190000.Dialogue: They're cute when they're about to wet themselves, aren't they? I'll make it easy for you. When you arrive at the lab in the morning, what sort of machine do you turn on?

00:05:55:030000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:05:55:030000.Dialogue: All right, Dr. Kooth-- uh, whatever it is-- you're up.

00:05:58:230000.Speaker: Raj
00:05:58:230000.Dialogue: It's Koothrappal I have to tinkle.

00:06:05:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:05:230000.Dialogue: And so, instead of bowing to pressure, and going to that pointless soiree, I stayed right here and did a load of whites.

00:06:13:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:13:210000.Dialogue: Well, normally I respect your macho rebellious attitude toward The Man, but, in this case, I think you've made a foolish mistake.

00:06:25:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:25:220000.Dialogue: But make your case. Keeping in mind that your critical attitude is ruining our Saturday night together, and I'm not above minimizing your window.

00:06:34:120000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:34:120000.Dialogue: Sheldon, like it or not, until you manage to upload your intelligence into a self-sustaining orbiting satellite, equipped with high-speed Internet and a cloaking device, you will be dependent on other members of the human race.

00:06:46:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:46:220000.Dialogue: That's it. Prepare to be minimized.

00:06:49:160000.Speaker: Amy
00:06:49:160000.Dialogue: I'm not finished. All scientists have to fund-raise, Sheldon. How do you think I paid for my lab? I went to Saudi Arabia and met with a prince who had an interest in neurobiology.

00:06:59:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:59:220000.Dialogue: Your lab is funded by some Middle-Eastern dilettante?

00:07:08:110000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:08:110000.Dialogue: But I do have a state-of-the-art two-photon microscope and a place to stay in Riyadh for the winter.

00:07:14:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:14:020000.Dialogue: Well, that explains those puzzling camel race photos on your Facebook page.

00:07:19:150000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:19:150000.Dialogue: And consider this: without you to make the case for the physics department, the task will fall to people like Leonard and Rajesh.

00:07:26:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:26:100000.Dialogue: Are you trying to scare me? 'Cause you're succeeding.

00:07:30:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:30:210000.Dialogue: Well, then prepare to be terrified. If your friends are unconvincing, this year's donations might go to, say, the geology department.

00:07:42:210000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:42:210000.Dialogue: Or worse-- it could go to... the liberal arts.

00:07:50:220000.Speaker: Amy
00:07:50:220000.Dialogue: Millions of dollars being showered on poets, literary theorists and students of gender studies.

00:08:03:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:03:030000.Dialogue: On the bright side, I don't think President Siebert will be making us go to any more fund-raisers.

00:08:08:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:08:170000.Dialogue: It was so much easier at my bar mitzvah. The old people just came up to you, pinched your cheek and handed you a savings bond.

00:08:15:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:15:110000.Dialogue: Oh, don't be such gloomy Gusses. Look at the size of these shrimp!

00:08:20:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:20:110000.Dialogue: At what point do we start calling them lobsters?

00:08:24:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:24:040000.Dialogue: Face it, Raj, we crashed and burned tonight.

00:08:27:110000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:08:27:110000.Dialogue: Oh, you didn't do that badly.

00:08:30:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:30:200000.Dialogue: Mrs. Latham, the first machine I turn on in the morning is the helium-neon laser, 'cause it needs to warm up.

00:08:38:040000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:08:38:040000.Dialogue: But don't worry, I really enjoyed meeting you this evening.

00:08:41:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:41:160000.Dialogue: u're kidding. That was good for you? 'Cause I was sweating through my T-shirt.

00:08:45:210000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:08:45:210000.Dialogue: Excellent! There's nothing I like better than making smart people feel ill at ease.

00:08:52:200000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:08:52:200000.Dialogue: Oh, I don't know, it's one of the fun things you get to do when you have lots of money. Watch. Hey! Who said you could eat that shrimp?

00:09:07:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:07:110000.Dialogue: No, no, no, I'm just here for your money. I don't want to shake anyone's germy hands.

00:09:21:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:21:080000.Dialogue: I must confess I don't understand you, President Siebert. First you say you want me to appear at your fund-raisers, but now you say you never want me to go anywhere near your fund-raisers. Forgive me, but that sounds like a mixed message. Here we go again. If there's simply no talking to me, why did you call?

00:09:40:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:40:230000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, someone's on the other line. Why don't you see if you can organize your thoughts, and we'll try again later.

00:09:48:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:48:130000.Dialogue: Cooper-Hofstadter residence. Go for Cooper. Good morning, Mrs. Latham. Well, yes, of course I remember you. A woman well past her prime seeking to augment her social status by doling out her late husband's ill-gotten gains.

00:10:03:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:03:080000.Dialogue: So, how much money are you going to give me?

00:10:06:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:06:200000.Dialogue: I'm not crazy-- my mother had me tested.

00:10:10:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:10:040000.Dialogue: Well, if you're not going to give me money, then why are you calling? She wants to talk to you. Who's crazy now?

00:10:20:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:20:210000.Dialogue: Hello, Mrs. Latham. Yes, I live with him. I don't... I-I really don't know why.

00:10:33:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:33:230000.Dialogue: Tonight? Sure, that'd be great. Okay, I'll see you then. Bye. She wants to have dinner and talk about my research.

00:10:44:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:44:050000.Dialogue: An entire dinner to talk about your research?

00:10:49:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:49:000000.Dialogue: Where you going, the drive-thru at Jack in the Box?

00:10:54:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:54:100000.Dialogue: Well, wherever we're going, she's sending a car to pick me up.

00:11:03:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:03:060000.Dialogue: My stature intimidates her, so she's using you to get to me.

00:11:12:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:12:230000.Dialogue: Excuse me, but you are not the only distinguished scientist in this apartment. I've been published in peer-reviewed journals, I received a Dissertation of the Year award for experimental particle physics.

00:11:23:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:23:000000.Dialogue: No, that can't be it. And since you seem to have forgotten, the reason we live together is we're best friends. And I got your back, Jack.

00:11:38:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:38:140000.Dialogue: The only time I eat this well is when my mom's in town and she takes me out to dinner.

00:11:44:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:44:050000.Dialogue: You kind of remind me of her. She enjoys making people uncomfortable, too.

00:11:49:190000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:11:49:190000.Dialogue: Well, you remind me of a boy I dated in college.

00:12:00:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:00:140000.Dialogue: Yeah, um... so, hey, speaking of money, how are you feeling about helping the physics department get a cryogenic centrifugal pump and molecular sieve?

00:12:10:170000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:12:10:170000.Dialogue: Well, I must say, you make a very persuasive case for it.

00:12:14:050000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:12:14:050000.Dialogue: And I'm seriously considering taking it to the next level.

00:12:19:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:19:030000.Dialogue: Terrific. Great. What level is that?

00:12:29:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:29:180000.Dialogue: Okay, now you don't remind me of my mom.

00:12:37:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:37:180000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, so, eventually, zombies are going to attack the rehab facility where Sandra Bullock is?

00:12:51:220000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:51:220000.Dialogue: You know, it's a shame, all that work she's doing to get sober, only to be torn apart and eaten alive.

00:13:05:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:05:140000.Dialogue: No. But we have potatoes-- I could make you vodka.

00:13:17:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:17:090000.Dialogue: Well, Mrs. Latham said she was seriously considering donating money so we could get a cryogenic centrifugal pump...

00:13:25:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:25:070000.Dialogue: ...then she stuck her tongue down my throat.

00:13:30:210000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:30:210000.Dialogue: Okay, we can't keep explaining everything. Read that book we got you.

00:13:37:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:37:150000.Dialogue: Wait-wait-wait. Are you telling us that old lady wanted to have sex with you in exchange for giving your department millions of dollars?

00:13:48:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:13:48:160000.Dialogue: You're really a broken toy, aren't you?

00:13:53:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:53:050000.Dialogue: I was able to get out of there before anything else happened, but she wants to see me again tomorrow night.

00:13:57:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:57:090000.Dialogue: Excellent! What are you planning to wear?

00:14:01:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:01:170000.Dialogue: Penny, you're an expert on trading sexual favors for material gain-- walk him through this.

00:14:07:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:07:220000.Dialogue: Well, n-no, hold on a second, I'm not going to sleep with her.

00:14:11:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:11:200000.Dialogue: But we need a cryogenic centrifugal pump.

00:14:15:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:15:060000.Dialogue: Well, forget it! It's not gonna happen.

00:14:17:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:17:230000.Dialogue: Well, come now, Leonard, this may be your only chance to make a real contribution to science!

00:14:29:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:14:29:160000.Dialogue: What was all that about me trading sexual favors for material gain?

00:14:34:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:34:060000.Dialogue: It was a compliment. I believe in giving credit where credit is due.

00:14:42:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:42:060000.Dialogue: Okay, fine. I'll tell him. Leonard, Mrs. Latham's car is here for you.

00:14:46:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:46:210000.Dialogue: I won't be too late; I'm just gonna make a final pitch for the funding and then say good night.

00:14:51:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:51:100000.Dialogue: Hold on, I have something for you.

00:14:56:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:56:040000.Dialogue: Just a few things you may need tonight. Baby oil, condoms and, uh...

00:15:00:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:00:230000.Dialogue: a little something I procured from the school of pharmacology. They say it is to Viagra as Viagra is to a green M&M.

00:15:11:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:11:090000.Dialogue: I am not going to have sex with her.

00:15:14:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:14:130000.Dialogue: Maybe this will overcome your reluctance. I went on the Internet and found a photograph of a 25-year-old Mrs. Latham to get your libido humming.

00:15:33:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:33:170000.Dialogue: Are you insane? I'm not going to prostitute myself just so we can get some new equipment.

00:15:42:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:42:130000.Dialogue: Given how much time you spend engaging in pointless self-abuse, you might consider, just this once, using your genitalia to actually accomplish something!

00:15:55:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:15:55:030000.Dialogue: He still won't shag the old lady, huh?

00:15:56:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:56:230000.Dialogue: No. But thank you for asking.

00:16:04:100000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:16:04:100000.Dialogue: Hello, Leonard. I hope you're hungry.

00:16:07:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:07:120000.Dialogue: I'm very hungry. For food, right?

00:16:11:220000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:16:11:220000.Dialogue: Oh, I made you uncomfortable last night. I'm so sorry.

00:16:17:130000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:16:17:130000.Dialogue: No, it most certainly is not. Leonard, I'm making the donation to your department regardless of what happens between us.

00:16:31:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:31:170000.Dialogue: Oh. Then what was last night about?

00:16:35:200000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:16:35:200000.Dialogue: I took a shot; sue me.

00:16:41:110000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:16:41:110000.Dialogue: You're a very handsome man, Leonard.

00:16:46:220000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:16:46:220000.Dialogue: It was foolish of me to think someone your age might ever be interested in someone like me.

00:16:52:190000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:52:190000.Dialogue: Oh, don't say that. You're a very attractive woman.

00:17:07:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:07:090000.Dialogue: I'm sure I would. But why-why, exactly?

00:17:12:190000.Speaker: Mrs Latham
00:17:12:190000.Dialogue: You're a very smart man. How do you think I landed such a rich husband?

00:17:17:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:17:180000.Dialogue: I hadn't really given it much thought.

00:17:33:080000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:17:33:080000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:35:000000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.

00:17:50:040000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:17:50:040000.Speaker: Penny

00:17:55:110000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:17:55:110000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:57:120000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:17:57:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:57:120000.Dialogue: Oh, please, I recognize the walk of shame when I see it. All you're missing is a little smeared mascara and a purse with panties wadded up in it.

00:18:05:170000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:18:05:170000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:07:090000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:18:07:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:07:090000.Dialogue: Oh, nothing's going on. Excuse me.

00:18:09:190000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:18:09:190000.Speaker: Leonard

00:18:11:160000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:18:11:160000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:14:110000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:18:14:110000.Speaker: Penny

00:18:15:140000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:18:15:140000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:18:070000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:18:18:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:18:070000.Dialogue: You sold yourself out like a common streetwalker!

00:18:21:150000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:18:21:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:21:150000.Dialogue: No, I didn't do it for the money.

00:18:25:120000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:18:25:120000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:27:120000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:18:27:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:27:120000.Dialogue: I believe that's what your roommate did to her.

00:18:30:090000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:18:30:090000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:18:32:080000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:18:32:080000.Speaker: Penny
00:18:32:080000.Dialogue: Again, read the book we gave you.

00:18:35:010000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:18:35:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:35:010000.Dialogue: No, I mean, I-I got the money first.

00:18:38:170000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:18:38:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:38:170000.Dialogue: Smart. Get paid up front. Yeah, I think you have a real knack for gigolo work, Leonard.

00:18:43:110000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:18:43:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:18:43:110000.Dialogue: Uh... I'm gonna go lie down.

00:18:47:000000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:18:47:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:47:000000.Dialogue: That's a good idea; get your rest. There are a lot more rich old ladies out there, and Daddy needs a new linear accelerator.

00:18:55:230000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:18:55:230000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:55:230000.Dialogue: And I thought he didn't learn anything from his relationship with you.

00:19:00:080000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:19:00:080000.Speaker: Penny

00:19:02:140000.Scene: The stairwell. Leonard is returning home looking dishevelled.
00:19:02:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:19:02:140000.Dialogue: Another compliment! Learn to recognize them.

00:19:11:080000.Speaker: Seibert
00:19:11:080000.Dialogue: Ah, there he is! The man of the hour! He took one for the team!

00:19:19:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:19:19:090000.Dialogue: I didn't do it for the money!

00:19:22:090000.Speaker: Seibert
00:19:22:090000.Dialogue: Keep telling yourself that-- it makes it easier. Trust me, I know.
